{{lowercase}} {{Infobox software | name = eXo | screenshot = [[File:EXo logo.png|90px]] | caption = | developer = eXo Platform SAS | latest release version = 3.5 | latest release date = 31 Jan 2012 | operating_system = [[Cross-platform]] | programming language = [[Java (programming language)|Java]], [[Groovy (programming language)|Groovy]], JavaEE Web Container | genre = [[Enterprise Social Platform]], [[Social software|Social collaboration]], Enterprise portal|Enterprise Portal, [[Enterprise Content Management|ECM]], [[Collaborative software]], | license = [[Affero General Public License]] version 3 and Proprietary<ref name="platform">{{cite web|author=Charles Humble|date=Sep 24, 2010|title=eXo Add Social Features to Version 3 of their Portal Platform|url=http://www.infoq.com/news/2010/09/exo3|publisher=[[InfoQ.com]]}}</ref> | website = http://www.exoplatform.com | blog = http://blog.exoplatform.com | community = http://community.exoplatform.com }} '''eXo ''' develops an [[open source]], standard-based, social-collaboration platform for [[Enterprise software|enterprise]]. eXo Platform offers social intranet and website capabilities with integrated features like wikis, forums, calendars, web contents and documents management capabilities along with activity streams, social networking and workspaces. All in a single platform.
==History== eXo began as an [[open source]] project in 2002 at [[ObjectWeb]] (now [[OW2]]), as the industry's first Java portlet container, an implementation of the [[JSR168]].<ref>{{cite web |title = Portlet Blog: eXo platform is JSR 168 | date = December 24, 2003 | url = http://portlets.blogspot.com/2003/12/exo-platform-is-jsr-168.html }}</ref> The eXo Project catalyzed a portal market dominated by a handful of very large vendors selling proprietary softwares.
The eXo Project grew into a company in 2003, as a response to a customer demand, which was the U.S. Department of Defense.
Today, eXo is a growing global company, with U.S. headquarters in San Francisco, California, global headquarters in France, and offices in Tunisia and Vietnam.
==Product== * '''eXo Platform 4''' - Open source, standard-based, full featured, and extensible Enterprise Social Platform. Feature list: ** Social Network ** Wiki ** Forum ** Calendar ** Document Management ** Web Content Management ** [[enterprise portal]] ** FAQ ** Events ** Tasks ** Portal ** Dashboards ** Standards compliance : JCR ([[JSR-170]].<ref>{{cite web |title = The Server Side:eXo released new JCR, Portlet Container, Portal, ECM and CS | date = July 1, 2008 | url = http://www.theserverside.com/news/thread.tss?thread_id=49918 }}</ref>), CMIS, OpenSocial, WEBDAV, FTP, iCal, JEE, Portlets ([[JSR-168]], [[JSR-286]], [[Web Services for Remote Portlets|WSRP]] 1 and 2) ** Enterprise Integration: single sign on (CAS, JOSSO, OpenSSO, Kerberos / SPNEGO, SAML), LDAP & Active Directory ** Databases : MySQL, Postgres, Oracle, MS SQLServer, Sybase, DB2 ** App Servers : Tomcat ** JVM : Oracle Java 6 and 7, OpenJDK 6 and 7, IBM Java 6 & 7
==Other open source projects== *'''GateIn''' - Merge of JBoss Portal and eXo Portal created GateIn. The [[GateIn Portal]] project creates an enterprise portal and portal framework to build upon depending on the need. *'''eXo Java Content Repository (JCR)''' - eXo's implementation of the [[JSR-170]] standard.
